# Space Law [italic][color=#ff0000]Last Updated March 7th, 2025. THE WIKI IS AUTHORITATIVE. This is intended as an in-game reference only and may be out of date.[/italic][/color]
On Space Station 14, stations operate under abbreviated space law. All crew, passengers, and visitors aboard the station are expected to follow these laws.
Foreign invaders, such as nuclear operatives, ninjas, and pirates, are not protected under space law. Traitors are not foreign invaders so are usually protected by space law.
In some sectors; the term 'Sophont' is used to describe any entity with human level of intelligence. Designation of 'Sophont' does not automatically grant protections under Space Law within the Floof Station Sector.

# Charges by Definition [italic]'Individual/Individuals' represents all crew, passengers, and visitors aboard the station who are protected under NT Space Law.[/italic]

1-01
Fearmongering
The action of deliberately arousing public fear or alarm about a particular issue.
Up to 5 minutes.
Fearmongering can be done both verbally and physically. All methods of communication made to disperse threats to groups of people can be fearmongering.
1-02
Animal Cruelty
To inflict unnecessary suffering on a sapient being with malicious intent.
3 minutes.
This applies to all station pets, including those adopted after the shift has started.
1-03
Theft
To unlawfully take property or items without consent.
2 minutes.
Any property is covered under this low, even those not considered 'Objective Items'.
1-06
Vandalism
To deface or superficially damage public property, or property belonging to another person.
2 minutes.
Vandalism can be as minor as defacement of property or people or as major as destroying windows and equipment.
1-09
Brandishing
To show a firearm or deadly weapon in public without proper permission to do so.
2 minutes.
This is specifically for the open display of firearms and deadly weapons outside of a code red or without expressed permission from command.
1-11
Possession
To be in unauthorized possession of restricted items or items of particular danger. See Controlled Substances/Items, Controlled Armaments.
Up to 5 minutes.
Anything that may be considered a Class 1 or Class 2 item on the Controlled Items and Substances.
1-12
Trespass
To enter into an area where one is not authorized nor invited
2 minutes.
Crew Manifest should be used as a guidelines for which individuals should have access to which restricted areas. IDs can be tampered.
1-15
Hooliganism
To intentionally and maliciously engage in disruptive conduct, where one refuses to cease.
As deemed appropriate by the arresting officer or Warden/HoS.
Any form of disruption that drives an individual to the point of calling security is applicable.
1-17
Failure To Comply
To willfully ignore lawful orders and commands provided by a Security Member or Command Member Code.
2 minutes.
Lawful orders are any order that does not violate Space Law or Company Policy.

# Modifiers by Definition Sentencing modifiers are to be applied by the sentencing officer, judge, or arbiter. Aggravating modifiers may not extend a sentence beyond the specified limit, while extenuating modifiers may not reduce a sentence below the specified limit.
## Intent Qualifiers - Code.- XXX-AXX
- [bold]Solicitation[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found guilty of encouraging, bribing, requesting, or instructing someone to commit a crime, with the intent that the Individual/Individuals being solicited to commit the crime, will receive for the crimes they solicited in full. Code. -XXX-A01 - [bold]Accessory[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found guilty of assisting in the commission of a crime, without participating in the crime itself, knowing that a crime will be, has been, or is being committed, will receive the sentence for the crimes in which they took part in full. Code. -XXX-A02 - [bold]Attempt[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found guilty of attempting to commit a crime, with the intent to carry out that crime, will receive the sentence for the crimes they attempted in full. Code. -XXX-A03 - [bold]Conspiracy[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found guilty of planning to commit a crime, with the intent to carry out that crime eventually, and having committed an overt act pursuant to that end, will receive the sentence for the crimes they conspired towards in full.
## Enhancers - Code.- XXX-BXX
- [bold]Deadly Weapon[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found guilty of committing a crime, utilizing any object used offensively for the purpose of inflicting mortal or great bodily harm, will receive an additional modifier of, at most, 150% of the original sentence. Code. -XXX-B01. Charge: 150% increase. - [bold]Aggravation[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found guilty of committing a crime with reckless abandon, evident signs of lack of regret or remorse, or blatant disregard for potential collateral damage, will receive an additional modifier of, at most, 150% of the original sentence. Code. -XXX-B02. Charge: 150% increase. - [bold]Discriminatory Intent[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found guilty of committing a crime based fully or in part based on the victim or affected party’s appearance, gender, psionics, religion, ability/disability, place of origin or habitation, culture, or other immutable feature or quality, will receive an additional modifier of, at most, 150% of the original sentence. Code. -XXX-B03. Charge: 150% increase. - [bold]Recidivism[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals convicted of the same criminal charge multiple times within one shift will receive an additional modifier of, at most, 200% of the original sentence. Code. -XXX-B04. Charge: 200% increase.
## Deductions - Code.- XXX-CXX
- [bold]Cooperation[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals who shares actionable intelligence with the authorities, turns oneself in, testifies against accomplices, confesses to their crime, or otherwise aids the prosecution, may have their sentence reduced to no less than 50% of the original sentence. Code. -XXX-C01. Charge: 50% Decrease. - [bold]Dire Emergency[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found to have committed a crime in the process of absolutely necessary and reasonable actions, taken with the intent to resolve or mitigate the effects of a dire emergency on one’s vessel or habitat, may have their sentence reduced by any amount, or completely waived. Code. -XXX-C02 - [bold]Self-Defense[/bold]
Any Individual/Individuals found to have committed a crime or crimes in protection of oneself or another, and only to the necessary extent to avert a direct and imminent threat to the health and life of innocent persons, may have their sentence reduced by any amount, or completely waived. Code. -XXX-C03 - [bold]Good Behavior[/bold]
Any convict who peacefully complies with the authorities, Displays clear signs of remorse concerning the committed crime, and/or conducts themselves peacefully while imprisoned, may be paroled as outlined in the Standard Operating Procedures. Code. -XXX-C04
# Sentence Types and Procedures
## Standard - [bold]Temporary Confinement[/bold]
Placing the convict into a temporary holding cell to serve predetermined sentence. - [bold]Catch & Release[/bold]
Taking the convict to Security, processing them, searching them, and then releasing them. - [bold]Demotion[/bold]
Downgrading the convict’s employment contract and revoking their access accordingly, with permission from or when ordered by the convict’s head of department. May be applied when the convict has committed a crime relating to their employment within their department or with NanoTrasen as a whole. - [bold]License Restriction[/bold]
Downgrading or suspending the convict’s armament license and confiscating possessions accordingly. May be applied when the convict is guilty of possession or a crime involving a weapon they were lawfully permitted to carry. - [bold]Mindbreaking[/bold]
Removal of the convict’s psionic power by use of Mindbreaker Toxin or any other means. May be applied when the convict is guilty of a crime in which they use psionics.
## Capital
[italic]Including charges totaling 25 minutes or greater.[/italic]
- [bold]Execution[/bold]
Termination of the convict’s life without the intent of future resurrection. Whenever any execution is performed, regardless of trial or not, a general announcement must be made detailing who was executed and for what reason.
The convict may select from one of four methods of execution, depending on availability:
- Firing Squad - Lethal Injection - Electric Shock - Asphyxiation.
If the convict does not make a choice after being given ample opportunity, the sentencing officer or other relevant authority may select the method that is most appropriate.
Convicts may request alternate methods of execution that may be approved or denied at the discretion of the individual passing the sentence. The executed’s corpse must be burned, stored in the morgue, or processed by medical staff using the biomass reclaimer. - [bold]Exfiltration[/bold]
Immediate retrieval of the convict via a CentComm, or GALPOL, dispatched transport. The prisoner may be held in a temporary cell until the transport arrives. If a transport cannot be arranged, default to other capital sentences. - [bold]Preservative Stasis[/bold]
Termination of the convict’s life with the expressed intent to perform a resurrection once the convict's body can be secured at Central Command. The convict's body is to be stored within a morgue or similar controlled and regulated environment to ensure the body does not rot or be destroyed. - [bold]Decorporealisation[/bold]
Stripping the convict’s mind from their body into a more restricting form such as borgification. - [bold]Extended Confinement[/bold]
Placing the convict into the brig until the end of the shift, where they are to be transported to Central Command for processing. The convict has the same rights as any other prisoner within the brig, whether they arrived by transport at start of shift or were sentenced to Extended Confinement.
